intro: Lycianthes pearcei, commonly known as the pearce's physalis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces distinctive lantern-shaped fruits that enclose its seeds, a feature typical of the genus Physalis. Its flowers are usually yellow with five petals and are pollinated by insects. Lycianthes pearcei is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and unique fruit structure.
